CatDescriptText: Mrs. Thelma Quarles, practical nurse, 1317 Vixen Street, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 8, 1958, pg. A1 with question: "Which of these sources of leadership do you believe Negroes generally follow: church, labor, or politics? Why?" answer reads: "I think that we follow politics.  It seems as though everything is done for politics and the people seem to go along with the trend and to follow it.  Some of them go for what they can get from politics, but in my opinion, the majority of them go by hearsay and not by the actual facts."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Thelma Quarles wearing dark textured coat and headband, standing on corner of Fifth and Liberty Avenues, May Building with Thrift Drugs in background, Downtown
